channel.title: Broc Lesnar in the UFC...?
channel.description:
Okay, probably a few of you know he was a WWE superstar, seeing as you all watch that crap. Anyway, I knew he was knew to the UFC, but I didn't know he was a WWE superstar. Looking at pictures of him, he is obviously on the juice. Now, what I wanted to know was how he got in the UFC? The UFC has more steroid tests than many of the other sports. Now, I saw his first fight against Frank Mir at UFC 81, and I was impressed for his first fight. Only tonight I find out he was a superstar in the WWE. I was pissed off to find this, as that faggotry does not belong in the UFC.
I know he wrestled professionally when he was young, but I would like a bit more information; can someone please help me find any? I've watched all promos about it, etc.

item.title: Broc Lesnar in the UFC...?
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:19, topic:229205”][quote author=phonnygoblin link=topic=301490.msg2426529#msg2426529 date=1220644536]
Negros, obviously the punches are fake, otherwise, as pointed out earlier, you would suffer severe concussions. But, I doubt any of us could last a scripted WWE fight like the ones the superstars have, cause uh, it’s kinda hard to fake jumping like 60 feet of the top of that cage thingy and landing on the ground.
[/quote]

Home dawg, I was talking about the special event they once had where there were three cages on top of each other and people fell off them. Seriously, that just hurts.

60ft…you’re an idiot. they fall like 16ft on to a springed floor. the superstars also train to do jumps+landings like that so they DONT hurt themselves.

also, falling 16ft is hardly getting the shit beaten out of you…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ckstunnerscape wrote:

Its fake, If these people get hit as “hard” as they say, they would almost 100 % get a concussion, Like with mark henry, 900 pound deadlife, Imagine if he actually swong a steel chair, Like he did a couple times in the WWE, If he hit someone with one for Real, They could possibly suffer a deadly concussion

item.title: Broc Lesnar in the UFC...?
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

Not what he meant. Where the fuck do you fucking fuckjews come from? He meant, it’s not fake, it’s scripted. As in, IT STILL HURTS. YOU STILL GET THE SHIT BEATEN OUT OF YOU. They just have story lines you have to follow. And by the way, they really do drug tests, but before Benoit killed himself and his family because of 'roid rage they were pretty lax on testing.

Read full topic

item.title: Broc Lesnar in the UFC...?
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

its both fake and scripted the ending is pre-planned however they basically say do whatever you want in the middle just make sure you lose if you are told to lose or win if you are told to win that’s why there good acters because they can make up what there going to do and choreograph it to the specific ending they want

Dana White has really slipped the ball here.

Anyway, I knew he was knew to the UFC, but I didn’t know he was a WWE superstar. Looking at pictures of him, he is obviously on the juice. Now, what I wanted to know was how he got in the UFC? The UFC has more steroid tests than many of the other sports. Now, I saw his first fight against Frank Mir at UFC 81, and I was impressed for his first fight. Only tonight I find out he was a superstar in the WWE. I was pissed off to find this, as that faggotry does not belong in the UFC.

I know he wrestled professionally when he was young, but I would like a bit more information; can someone please help me find any? I’ve watched all promos about it, etc.[/quote]I agree 100%. WWE is the stupidest shit on tv. Everyone takes steroids, it is just stupid. As if they are hitting people with chairs.

Anyhow, there are tons of performance enhancing steroids which can’t be tested for. They probably were lenient on him in order to attract more WWE viewers to UFC.
